snippet: Doctors operating their own in-office pharmacies are raising the costs for insurance companies, employers and taxpayers.
abstract: Rules in some states that govern workers' compensation insurance allow doctors to dispense drugs at a large markup directly from their office rather than having patients go through a pharmacy; experts say through the practice, doctors, middlemen and drug distributors are adding hundreds of millions of dollars annually to the costs borne by taxpayers, insurance companies and employers.

byline.original: By BARRY MEIER and KATIE THOMAS

lead_paragraph: Doctors operating their own in-office pharmacies are raising the costs for insurance companies, employers and taxpayers.

headline.seo: Some Doctors Cash In by Being Their Own Pharmacist
headline.main: Insurers Pay Big Markups as Doctors Dispense Drugs
headline.print_headline: Drugs Dispensed By Doctors Cost Insurers Dearly
